intro: Clidemia ciliata var. grandifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with ciliate margins. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm climates.
